intro: Cissampelos miersiana, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
